Dear Alyssa Renee Noe:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
8/4-8/11/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact WOC area manager Shay Mavis at 269-243-2725.
Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12324 Reevaluation
• (3) An agency shall record the dates and places of
contacts and persons interviewed or observed as
part of a reevaluation.
Two of Six files of open foster homes reviewed contained reevaluation reports that
did not identify the types of SOGIE preferred by applicants.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (2) For an emergency placement, if any of the
information specified in subrule (1)(a) to (h) of this
rule is not available at the time of placement, then
the agency shall provide information to the foster
parent within 7 calendar days of the placement.
One of Eight files of youth currently in foster care placements reviewed did not
contain documentation that all information required to be provided to caregiver
within 7 days of emergency placement was provided timely.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Utilize the CWL-4624 for all child welfare staff prior to hire.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There was 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The one special evaluation completed by the agency resulting in
abuse/neglect substantiation was reviewed. The investigation was regarding
allegations of sexual abuse of youths by their foster father. The agency
recommendation of revocation was appropriate based on the information
documented within the report.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
4

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The one
CAP was submitted in response to the 7/8/2024 licensing inspection report and
was approved on 7/15/2024. That CAP addressed 16 violations, 6 of which were
MDHHS policy requirements no longer regulated by DCWL. The remaining 10
violations were related to licensing rules and were adequately addressed through
the CAP as evidenced by only one of those violations being repeated during this
year's inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment dated 6/10/2025 was reviewed and discussed
during the inspection entrance meeting. The chief administrator described the
implementation of the previous year's inspection CAP which has been successful
in addressing the non-compliance areas. The chief administrator indicated the
program manager and supervisors meet monthly to discuss the effectiveness of
any CAPs, KPI metrics, and to identify any needed adjustments to agency
procedures.
Financial Overview
Reviewed the agency's income statements/budget ending 2/28/2025, financial
reports and independent auditor's report. No financial concerns were identified.
Staff Interviews
All the staff interviewed reported positive experiences working at the agency.
Specifically, they all reported receiving supportive supervision and assistance from
co-workers and management when needed. No concerns were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency office appears to have adequate space and equipment to provide for
the delivery of foster home certification, foster care, adoption, and independent
living services. The files are stored securely in a locking file room preventing
unauthorized access. Physical CHRI is stored in a separate cabinet within the
locked office. A cross shredder is located within a staff member's office.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
No safety concerns were identified.
5

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
